4.text: Arjuna: Mother, how did this world begin? Mother: Well, there are many different ideas about that. Radhika, why don't you tell your brother what you learnt about it at school? Radhika: Scientists believe that the earth was created from a ball of dust and gas. The earth was very hot then. Gradually, it cooled down and hardened. Arjuna: Wow! What happened after that?
4.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Arjuna: Mother, how did this world begin? Mother: Well, there are many different ideas about that. <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='ɾaːd̪ika'>Radhika</phoneme>, why don't you tell your brother what you learnt about it at school? <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='ɾaːd̪ika'>Radhika</phoneme>: Scientists believe that the earth was created from a ball of dust and gas. The earth was very hot then. Gradually, it cooled down and hardened. Arjuna: Wow! What happened after that?</prosody></speak>

5.text: Radhika: The land, the sea and the atmosphere began to form but there was no life on Earth. Arjuna: Nothing at all? Radhika: Nothing at all. Life first began in the sea as a bacterium. Plants appeared next on land, followed by animals.
5.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'><phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='ɾaːd̪ika'>Radhika</phoneme>: The land, the sea and the atmosphere began to form but there was no life on Earth. Arjuna: Nothing at all? <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='ɾaːd̪ika'>Radhika</phoneme>: Nothing at all. Life first began in the sea as a bacterium. Plants appeared next on land, followed by animals.</prosody></speak>
